org.logicmill.util.concurrent

Class BucketOrderException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • org.logicmill.util.concurrent.SegmentIntegrityException
          • org.logicmill.util.concurrent.BucketOrderException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class BucketOrderException
extends SegmentIntegrityException
    Thrown by ConcurrentHashMapAuditor.verifyMapIntegrity(boolean, int) to indicate that entries in a hash map bucket are not in order. Order in the bucket's linked list must correspond to the order of increasing offsets from the bucket index.
    Author:
    David Curtis
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • BucketOrderException

        public BucketOrderException(ConcurrentHashMapProbe.SegmentProbe segmentProbe,
                    int bucketIndex,
                    int offset,
                    int nextOffset)
        Creates a BucketOrderException with the specified details.
        Parameters:
        segmentProbe - proxy for segment in which exception occurred; uses reflection to access private segment internals
        bucketIndex - index of the bucket with out-of-order entries
        offset - offset from bucket index of the entry preceding the out-of-order entry
        nextOffset - offset from bucket index of the out-of-order entry

    • Method Detail

      • getBucketIndex

        public int getBucketIndex()
        Returns:
        the index of the bucket containing the out-of-order entry

      • getOffset

        public int getOffset()
        Returns:
        the offset of the entry preceding the out-of-order entry

      • getNextOffset

        public int getNextOffset()
        Returns:
        the offset of the out-of-order entry
